column4: I am trying to mount iso in the format mount -t type device location, what exactly is the device? the file name?
Doh... wait, mounting an iso, right, path to file.
Btw, right-click on an empty spot in the gnome menubar, select "add to panel", and select the Disk Mounter applet.
mount point is the spot in the file system hierarchy that you want the device to show up.
Usually you have to do:  1) $ mkdir /home/bluezone/myisomountpoint
this even more complicated because im trying to get these to run on wine lol
so maybe the mount point must be somwhere in /.wine/...
Now you're outside my area of knowledge, haven't mucked with wine at ll.
Btw, also check out Pysdm, a GUI tool to help manage mounting.  Don't know if it handles isos.
yeah i had to mount it to /home/bluezone/.wine
then it appeared on the mounter on gnome
hehe, im so proud of myself now, diablo is working flawlessly! thanks man
